node.title: Video Shows Moment Gunman Opens Fire on Pedestrians in Front of New York City Deli
node.description: No arrests had been made in connection with the mid-November shooting by midday Tuesday, according to police.

node.title: Oxford School District Declines Michigan AG's Offer to Investigate What Led to Shooting
node.description: The district chose to have a third party investigate the events leading up to the November 30 shooting at the high school in which four students were killed.

node.title: Is foam rolling actually effective for muscle pain and flexibility?
node.description: Many people swear by foam rollers to reduce muscle pain and increase flexibility after exercise. But does the science support anecdotal evidence that encourages their use?

node.title: 'We have to filter out the crispy bits': How leftover chip oil will keep EV owners moving across the Nullarbor
node.description: EV owners are crowdfunding a fast charger in the middle of the Nullarbor — and it will run on leftover chip oil from the local roadhouse.

node.title: The surprising architect behind Labor's climate plans? A retiring Coalition minister
node.description: Before he became Health Minister, Greg Hunt spent years thinking about mechanisms for getting emissions down – and if elected, Labor plans to road test the one he introduced, writes Peter Martin.

node.title: One step from a sporting revolution: How Usman Khawaja is changing the face of Australian cricket
node.description: Trailblazer Usman Khawaja talks about racism in cricket and urges Cricket Australia to diversify for the sake of the game.

node.title: Cryptocurrency scams have 'exploded' during the pandemic. These three Australians lost more than $600,000
node.description: Australian police say cryptocurrency scams have "exploded" during the pandemic. These three families were sucked in.

node.title: 'I was actually molested': Olympian Maddie Groves says she was abused as a teenage swimmer
node.description: Australian Olympic swimmer Madeline Groves says she was sexually abused by a man who still works in swimming and says there is a culture of "misogyny” and “perversion" in the sport.

node.title: Air NZ outlines path to reach net zero carbon emissions by 2050
node.description: Sustainable aviation fuel is expected to play a big role in Air New Zealand's decarbonisation plans, as it targets net zero carbon emissions by 2050.

node.title: Covid-19: Northland border checkpoints to sticker cars
node.description: Tai Tokerau Border Control says visitors heading to Northland will pass through checkpoints easily if everyone in their vehicle has a vaccine pass. Audio

node.title: Lake Alice: Lawyer's submission for alleged abuser rejected
node.description: A psychiatrist accused of torturing patients at the Lake Alice child and adolescent unit has failed to escape criticism from a Royal Commission.

node.title: Jussie Smollett again denies faking attack: "There was no hoax"
node.description: Smollett is facing six felony counts of disorderly conduct for allegedly lying to police about what happened that night.

node.title: Bronx dad makes homemade food for homeless
node.description: Marty Rogers and his volunteers go on "Hope Walks" three times a week, delivering homemade food to people in their South Bronx community.

node.title: China’s Hockey Team Avoids Being Cut From Beijing Olympics
node.description: Ending months of debate, the Chinese team, whose proxy team lost two evaluation games last month, will compete in the Beijing Games.

node.title: Where Have All the Grown-ups Gone?
node.description: Somehow, America stopped honoring responsibility.

node.title: The Russian and American leaders have two very different agendas.
node.description: Vladimir V. Putin wants Russia to retain sway over western-leaning Ukraine. President Biden aims to secure a more stable and predictable relationship with Russia.

node.title: Gunman Opens Fire, Kills 2 at Moscow Service Center After Being Told to Put on Mask
node.description: A 10-year-old girl is among the four injured in the shooting. Two employees of the government center were killed in the attack.

node.title: 'Sarco' Assisted Suicide Pod Could Be Available in 2022 After Passing Review in Switzerland
node.description: An assisted suicide machine's portability gives users the option of choosing where they spend their final moments.

node.title: Kids 5 to 14 Account for Highest Number of COVID Cases in Europe, Delta Still Dominant: WHO
node.description: WHO reported that COVID-19 infected children two to three times more than the average population in the European region.

node.title: Good Samaritan Stumbles Upon $1M in Cocaine Floating in Florida Waters
node.description: A similar discovery occurred in March when $1.3 million worth of cocaine washed up ashore on the Florida Keys' beaches.

node.title: The Most Expensive Advent Calendars of 2021: From Chanel to Guerlain
node.description: Count down the days until Christmas with these indulgent advent calendars, offering a host of luxury items from perfumes to accessories.

node.title: U.S. More Popular Than China Abroad, Poll Finds, as Tensions Mount With Olympics Boycott
node.description: The net favorability of the U.S. in all European nations surveyed has risen considerably since Joe Biden took office, according to the survey.

node.title: Groups hope to save Florida's manatees amid record deaths
node.description: Humans caused this problem and we need to fix it, said Cora Berchem, who works for the nonprofit Save the Manatee.

node.title: American Airlines CEO Doug Parker stepping down
node.description: "Now is the right time for a handoff," said Parker, who'll be replaced by the airline's current president, Robert Isom.

node.title: An Expansive New Book From Amanda Gorman, Celebrity Poet and Inaugural Star
node.description: Gorman’s latest poetry collection, “Call Us What We Carry,” offers reverence and effervescence, gravity and impishness, and poems that are focused, pithy and playfully heretical.

node.title: A Meeting With Maxwell Led to Years of Sex With Epstein, Accuser Says
node.description: A woman identified only as “Kate” told jurors at Ghislaine Maxwell’s sex-trafficking trial that Ms. Maxwell leveraged their friendship to encourage her to have sex with Jeffrey Epstein.

node.title: 10-Month-Old Baby Among Survivors When Building Explodes, Father Killed in Blast
node.description: A baby and its parents were pulled from the rubble after a building in southeastern France exploded. The child and mother survived, but the father was killed.

node.title: New York City Weighing Bill for 800K Noncitizens to Vote in City Elections
node.description: New York City is close to approving a bill that would allow any legal permanent residents of longer than 30 days to vote in city elections.

node.title: Navy Shuts Down Fuel Complex After Discovery of Gas Leaking Into Honolulu Drinking Water
node.description: Hundreds of households had complained of a fuel odor or side effects like vomiting and stomach cramps after ingesting the contaminated water.

node.title: Video From Inside McDonald's Where Gunman Barricaded Himself Viewed Over 22M Times
node.description: The incident occurred in Fort Myers, Florida on October 23 after the gunman shot at police and entered the McDonald's.
